body.p: To His Excellency Beriah Maggoffin Governor of The Commonwealth of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Caldwell County Kentucky have long known Thomas B Wadlington & he has Ever been considered a good & true hearted Citizen Known & noted for his industry & orderly conduct. The Difficulty in which he was engaged with Milton A Cartwright did not appear to us to be of his seeking nor are we satisfied that the case was presented to the Jurry as it really occurred -- We hope yr Excellency will review the case & give the poor man the benefit of Every doubt orand we desire that His case may be judged in mercy & regarded with favor -- & that yr Excellency will take into consideration Every circumstance that ought to opperate in his favor -- & we desire that yr excellency may & will be persuaded that it is consistent with yr duty to extend to him executive clemency & that his life may be sparred either by a full pardon or by a commutation of his punishment Yrs Respy
Jany 21st 1861

J. A. Mott

Sworn to before, Me who I am assured signed Whilest this was in the Hands of W D Lindsly
Sworn to before me by T A Lowey this 28 Jany 1861,
